pr_title: Issue #4747 - fix some test failures for jetty-10 with websocket tck

timeline.message:
Issue #4747 - Default close status code should be normal status

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - SessionID should return same String instance

Using the object hash code is not random enough to use as a unique ID.
Now using UUID.randomUUID() instead which sufficiently random.

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - Throwing in onClose now calls onError

- This applies to the javax onClose method not the core onClosed method.
- Also fixes a bug where onClosed may never be called if onFrame throws.

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - Fix WS path params to work within a context path

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - correctly copy headers in websocket JsrUpgradeListener

Headers with the same name may not have been copied properly for
header values inspected and modified with a Configurator.

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - filter out synthetic annotated methods

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - filter out synthetic annotated methods

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4747 - server is allowed to not select a websocket subprotocol

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I would much rather keep CloseStatus immutable and replace the entire object than have it partially immutable.
Why isn't the cause known when it is created? feels wrong!
timeline.author: gregw

timeline.bodyText: this seams wrong.  If we were closed for some other reason, then adding a cause to it could put the wrong cause against a close reason.
timeline.author: gregw

replies.bodyText:
If we received an abnormal close frame and throw in onFrame then we want to keep the same close reason but we want to call onError as well so we need to add a cause to the close status so that onError is notified. I can actually change this line to get rid of the weird initCause method.
_closeStatus = new CloseStatus(_closeStatus.getCode(), _closeStatus.getReason(), t);
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

replies.bodyText:
Definitely change to keep the close status immutable and get rid of the init.
But can you describe more.... maybe in comments... exactly why if we already have a close that we want to change just the cause and not the status and the reason as well?
replies.author: gregw

timeline.bodyText: So it is OK to not select a subprotocol?
timeline.author: gregw

replies.bodyText:
It's okay to not select one of the offered subprotocols as long as no subprotocol header is sent back.
If the client's handshake did not contain such a header field or if
the server does not agree to any of the client's requested
subprotocols, the only acceptable value is null.  The absence
of such a field is equivalent to the null value (meaning that
if the server does not wish to agree to one of the suggested
subprotocols, it MUST NOT send back a |Sec-WebSocket-Protocol|
header field in its response).
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.bodyText: This looks like it may be called a few times per upgade? if so, perhaps do the addPaths in the constructor.
timeline.author: gregw

replies.bodyText: It is only called once per upgrade, when creating the FrameHandler.
replies.author: lachlan-roberts

timeline.message:
Issue #4747 - changes from review

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>
